body: Can you please also include the GoCD and plugin version you're using.
And the config file is located on the home folder right? Also the config you pasted is missing a closing `}` at the end, I suppose that's just a copy-paste issue?

Yup, the closing brace is a copy/paste issue.
The file does exist in the expected directory path - /data/go-server/home
No luck. Tried with the updated config. Same error, same line.

You had to restart the Go Server after the change for the plugin to pick it up. 

Give me couple of days. I'll try to get a new patched version with more logs so we can debug further. Meanwhile if you're interested to pick it up, [this line](https://github.com/ashwanthkumar/gocd-slack-build-notifier/blob/master/src/main/java/in/ashwanthkumar/gocd/slack/ruleset/Rules.java#L169) is where I'm suspecting something is happening. The exception is actually IGNORED, instead we should throw a RuntimeException there and fail.

I spin up a new container every time, and verified the modified config file was indeed available at the expected location.

Thanks for the help. Do keep us posted.
@ashwanthkumar : Hey! Is a patch available for this issue?

@argha-c The exception from your minimal config seems to be `java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Slack Webhook url starts with https://hooks.slack.com/services/`

@ashwanthkumar You're right that the [line](https://github.com/ashwanthkumar/gocd-slack-build-notifier/blob/master/src/main/java/in/ashwanthkumar/gocd/slack/ruleset/Rules.java#L169) causes the actual error to be ignored which then causes the NullPointerException when the `getPipelineListener()` is called.

issue.title: Trying to connect to Rocket.Chat

repository.name: gocd-slack-build-notifier
repository.description: GoCD (gocd.org) plugin to push build notifications to Slack

issue.body:
I've just installed this plugin (v1.2.0) to go-server (v16.1.0). And setting up to send the notifications to Rocket.Chat slack's compatible API.

my go_notify.conf

```
gocd.slack {
  login = "rocketchat"
  password = "valid-go-server-user-pass"
  server-host = "http://localhost:8153/"
  webhookUrl = "Provided valid rocket.chat integration url"
}
```

And I'm getting this error when the plugin tries to send the notification:

```
2016-03-14 14:58:07,714  WARN [69@MessageListener for PluginNotificationListener] PluginNotificationService:78 - Notification update failed for plugin: slack.notifier
java.lang.RuntimeException: Interaction with plugin with id 'slack.notifier' implementing 'notification' extension failed while requesting for 'stage-status'. Reason: [The plugin sent a response that could not be understood by Go. Plugin returned with code '500' and the following response: '{"status":"failure"}']
    at com.thoughtworks.go.plugin.access.PluginRequestHelper.submitRequest(PluginRequestHelper.java:38)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.plugin.access.notification.NotificationExtension.notify(NotificationExtension.java:66)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.server.messaging.plugin.PluginNotificationService.notifyPlugin(PluginNotificationService.java:61)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.server.messaging.plugin.PluginNotificationService.notifyPlugins(PluginNotificationService.java:53)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.server.messaging.plugin.PluginNotificationListener.onMessage(PluginNotificationListener.java:30)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.server.messaging.plugin.PluginNotificationListener.onMessage(PluginNotificationListener.java:21)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.server.messaging.activemq.JMSMessageListenerAdapter.runImpl(JMSMessageListenerAdapter.java:65)
    at com.thoughtworks.go.server.messaging.activemq.JMSMessageListenerAdapter.run(JMSMessageListenerAdapter.java:50)
    at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: The plugin sent a response that could not be understood by Go. Plugin returned with code '500' and the following response: '{"status":"failure"}'
    at com.thoughtworks.go.plugin.access.PluginRequestHelper.submitRequest(PluginRequestHelper.java:36)
    ... 8 more
```

Any idea what could I do wrong?

body: @argha-c I'm sorry for getting back late on this. We now have a [release](https://github.com/ashwanthkumar/gocd-slack-build-notifier/releases/tag/v1.2.1) (v1.2.1) which actually fails on that error line instead of silently failing elsewhere. Please do try it out and let me know if that helps.

issue.title: Add tests minimal config

repository.name: gocd-slack-build-notifier
repository.description: GoCD (gocd.org) plugin to push build notifications to Slack

issue.body:
Added logging which should help solving problems in case loading configurations fail. Now the root cause should be visible in the plugin log file.

Added some tests for different minimal configurations (without default configurations in config file):
- No pipelines (Example in readme)
- One pipeline (Issue #23)
- Invalid configuration file (Related to issue #23)

Fixed a bug which caused plugin's default pipeline state value to override config file pipeline's state value.

body: @ashwanthkumar Cool, thanks for the fix. Will take a look.
